definition: relay baton/(fig.) responsibilities (passed over to one's successor)
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
stick/club/cudgel/smart/capable/strong/wonderful/classifier for legs of a relay race

sentences.english: They both passed on their bacons at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 他們倆都同時把接力棒傳了過去。

sentences.english: At the end of the first lap, Li Lei quickly passed the stick on to Jim.
sentences.chinese: 在第一圈結束時，李雷迅速地把接力棒傳給了吉姆。

sentences.english: The Japanese side will cooperate with China to pass on the baton of World Expo.
sentences.chinese: 日方將與中國合作，將世界博覽會接力棒傳遞好。

sentences.english: But the reason you're hiring them is because you're going to give them the reins.
sentences.chinese: 可是你招他們進來就是爲了把接力棒交到他們手裏。

definition: lit. the flame of a burning piece of firewood passes on to the rest (idiom)/fig. (of knowledge, skill etc) to be passed on from teachers to students, one generation to another
the cassock and alms bowl of a Buddhist master passed on to the favorite disciple (Buddhism)/legacy/mantle
to shoulder (a burden)/to bear/to suffer (a disadvantage)
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
to pass on experience (to the next generation)
mission/long-term task to which one devotes oneself/a calling
to develop/to make full use of
